[h1]The Toxicity of our City...[/h1]

I've logged 666 hours into this game at the time of writing this review. In those 666 hours I've experienced a plethora of emotions and thoughts on Dead by Daylight. I cannot trash something I've spent so much time on, but there's been many ups and downs over the course. Dead by Daylight has "changed" over the years, but it's pretty much kept the same for the most part. An Asymmetrical Horror game revolving around 4 survivors trying to escape a lone killer. Survivors attempt to power generators to open the exit gates all the while alluding the killer. That's it, Dead by Daylight's only game mode, so it has to be fantastic right?  Yes and no, when the game functions properly it's a fun and exciting gameplay loop, but when it fails it becomes a buggy shit show. 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Fun Asymmetrical Gameplay/Good Loop
+ Licensed Killers
+ Consistent updates

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Queue times can be horrific
- Wonky hit-boxes and hit registration/very inconsistent
- All survivors play identical

[b]The Rest:[/b]
The Toxic community, while you could list it as a negative, I believe this to be the driving force behind the amazing longevity of the game. There's a sense of rage and anger that  keeps the game fresh. As a killer being blinded repeatedly and "tea bagged" at exit gates enrages you and fuels your fire for more slaughter. Survivors, getting basement camped or tunneled sucks and it pisses you off, but you know what 3 years later you're still on the same damn game.

[b]Verdict:[/b] ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ
In the end, the core gameplay mechanics work(when they work) and it can be a really unique and fun experience. I'd deffinitely recommend this to anyone wanting to sink their teeth into an asymetrical multiplayer game, it's one of the best ones out there. 

[b]TLDR:[/b] "This game is fucking ass!", plays for eternity.

I finally gave Dead by Daylight a try. About 46 hours in the past 2 weeks and I have some thoughts:
1. The game is a ton of fun for both killer and survivor and offers a bunch of ton of replayability and things to chase.
2. So many perks to try and different play styles.
3. The licensed characters and levels are really cool. Only wish they had more customization options.

Gonna talk about a few gripes tho:
1. The game enables toxicity via gameplay. More for killers to subject survivors to than the other way around, but  survivors and make a shitty experience for the killer as well. As much as I everyone would like the community to police themselves for this kind of crap.. if you give players the opportunity to play like dicks, they will play like dicks. And it's my opinion that Behavior Interactive to do more things to prevent this.

A common thing is when the killer has the game in hand but then decides to take the game hostage by just not completing the actions to end the game. There needs to be a give up option for survivors and isn't just disconnecting and taking a matchmaking timeout

I would also suggest limiting certain combinations of killer perks from be run together. Or make some perks hex perks so they can at least be countered by the survivors. There are some builds out there that just too strong and make for a negative play experience.

Then there is tunneling. When a killer focuses one player out of the game is a shitty experience. High rank killers often won't do that, but if you are new and lower rank, I can use how this just turns you away from the game forever.

I think there needs to be diminishing returns on tunneling a player. Make it so not in the killers best interest to play that way. Maybe killing a player before X Generator are completed gives a bug gen repair boost or something.

Let's talk a little about survivor bullying. Flashlights and body blocking hooks just to troll the killer sucks. That should be on the devs to give the killer an out on that kind of lobby.

And finally, the way you level up your killers and survivors needs a rework. It's almost like leveling a character is one loot box after another and hoping you get the perks you want. It's pretty trash and needs to be looked at. 

Overall, really love the game and I'm having a ton of fun, but there are some gripes that listed above that need to be looked at imo. The good news is that at least some of those things are reportedly be looked into by the devs

Dead by daylight is vary addictive in it's game play, from the thrilling rush playing as a survivor to the almost competitive feel of a killer. The game dose a good job at balancing and teaching the player more and more about the game through leveling up characters to just gaining experience from just playing the game. My only major jripe would be the charaters, if you want more then just the base survivors and killers you'll either have to grind a lot of rare points or put money into the game whitch is the best thing to do. With many references and throw backs to popular horror movies this is a must play for fans of the horror jauna. 8/10 recommend

This game is a buggy piece of shit. Playing a survivor often means matchmaking with the three biggest potatoes in the entire game, every game, unless you have a survive with friends crew. If you do have a survive with friends queue, queue times will be about ten minutes a game most of the time, and then the killer won't like your SWF and will facecamp their first down. 

When you play killer, you'll generally encounter survivors who are frustrated with the above problems, and they take it out on you. You'll see survivors with strong items, map offerings, often keys, and usually some teabagging. This can lead to a very frustrating experience, so many killers resort to facecamping or stop playing killer. Somehow, playing killer rarely results in seeing as many potatoes as playing survivor.

Because playing killer can be frustrating, this leads to many killers stopping playing or playing survivor, and results in higher queue times for remaining survivors, which helps contribute to frustrating survivors.

That being said, the gameplay is really interesting, the management of time and the use of resources (pallets and vaults) in chase, plus the play and counterplay (except spirit, fuck you) of each killer contributes to making both killer and survivor an enjoyable experience. Dead by Daylight is my favourite piece of shit.

This game is genuinely a piece of shit and that's a shame since it's such a nice idea.
The community is awful, every single update is a buggy mess (that somehow has more bugs then the test servers?????????) and it's generally a bad experience.
console teammates find amazing new ways to remove their brains from their body's and don't even TRY and play without crossplay because then the wait for a match will look like 30 minutes instead of 3.
The game also encourages shitty play and strats with camping and tunneling going COMPLETELY unpunished despite how awful an experience it makes.

I WANT to like this game but in it's current state that's straight up not possible since you're literally forced to use a certain perk build if you don't want to get tunneled into oblivion, which is not how I want to play the game
